/work/doc/pages/RxTimestamp.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 \defgroup rx-timestamping Taking timestamps of the received data
2 \ingroup advanced-programming
3 
4 
5 \details
6 
7 On Linux, the handler can probe the timestamp of the received data and provide it to the user along with the data. This
8 can be useful to monitor the TCP/IP stack performance:
9 
10 \snippet RxTimestamp.cpp UseRxDataTimestamp
11 
12 Depending on the `Session` configuration, hardware capabilities, and the operation system,
13 OnixS::B3::BOE::ReceivedDataTimestamp::Source
14 can have the following values:
15 
16 - `None`: no timestamp is taken;
17 - `Software`: a timestamp provided by the OS kernel / user-level network stack is taken;
18 - `Hardware`: a timestamp provided by the network card is taken;
19 
20 If accessible, the network interface card timestamp is used (`ReceivedDataTimestamp::Source::Hardware`);
21 otherwise, the timestamp supplied by the OS kernel or the user-level network stack is used
22 (`ReceivedDataTimestamp::Source::Software`).
23 
24 To configure the session to take the timestamp, OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionSettings::enableRxTimestamp must be set:
25 \snippet RxTimestamp.cpp RxDataTimestampOn
26 
27 If the OnixS `TcpDirectStack` is used, the timestamping must be enabled on the stack level:
28 \snippet RxTimestamp.cpp RxDataTimestampOnTcpDirectStack
29 
30 If the [Solarflare OpenOnload](https://www.xilinx.com/support/download/nic-software-and-drivers.html) is used,
31 the `EF_RX_TIMESTAMPING` environment variable must be set to `1`:
32 
33  EF_RX_TIMESTAMPING=1 onload ./onixs-b3-boe-app
34 
35 To compare hardware-based timestamps with the host time, it is necessary to synchronize the network interface card clock
36 with the host clock, as described in [IEEE 1588-2008](https://standards.ieee.org/ieee/1588/4355/).
37 
38 For the Solarflare cards, the
39 [`sfptpd`](https://www.xilinx.com/content/dam/xilinx/publications/solarflare/drivers-software/linux/ptp/SF-109110-CD-8_Solarflare_Enhanced_PTP_User_Guide.pdf)
40 utility can be used to perform this synchronization.
41 
42 **Note**: According to our measurements, enabling this feature adds around `50` - `100` nanoseconds to the resulting
43 latency.
44 
45 **Note**: This functionality is available on Linux only.
46 
47 This [article](https://ref.onixs.biz/detecting-tcp-congestion.html) describes how to detect TCP congestion using
48 described functional.
